diff_hunk:
@@ -622,6 +629,10 @@ def _beam_search_step(time, logits, next_cell_state, beam_state, batch_size,
       range_size=beam_width,
       gather_shape=[-1])
   next_prediction_len += lengths_to_add
+  next_prediction_len = array_ops.where(next_beam_probs > -np.Inf,
body:
Do you mean if `next_beam_probs > -np.Inf` can be evaluated to be True if t>0? it can.

Or maybe you mean `next_beam_probs > -np.Inf` can only be evaluated to be False when t=0? 
well, when vocabulary is small then it could be evaluated to be False. I was trying to use your Beamsearch to the test phase of pointer network, and the vocabulary can't be determined when building the graph. and it usually is small.

Do you mean if next_beam_probs > -np.Inf can be evaluated to be True if t>0? it can.
Or maybe you mean next_beam_probs > -np.Inf can only be evaluated to be False when t=0?
well, when vocabulary is small then it could be evaluated to be False. I was trying to use your Beamsearch to the test phase of pointer network, and the vocabulary can't be determined when building the graph. and it usually is small.
